meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Kerry Greene Alex Jacob Matt Jackson Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7175.

td.p: Kerry Greene, a volunteer CASA guardian ad litem from Manchester, New Hampshire (subtotal of $3,400)
Alex Jacob, a currency trader from Chicago, Illinois (subtotal of $29,600)
Matt Jackson, a paralegal from Washington, D.C. (subtotal of $3,000)

tr.td: WRITERS MAKE PRETTY GOOD FRIENDS
CABLE SHOWS
LESSER-KNOWN SUPERHEROES
(Alex Trebek: Keep in mind that each response will end in "I-Z-E-R", okay?)
BODIES OF WATER
FIT BITS
HOW MANY MILES?

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Ezra Pound was a friend & mentor to him, arranging for the serialization of his "A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: Ezra Pound was a friend & mentor to him, arranging for the serialization of his "A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man"

Scientists at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory collaborated on the discovery of element number 116, which was even named livermorium; it was created by smashing atoms of curium, atomic number 96, with atoms of this element

(Alex Jacob: Wow.)
KerryWho is Kierkegaard?
$1,500
MattWho is . . .
$0
AlexWho Thanks to everyone who works on the world\'s greatest game show!!
$0
Søren Kierkegaard')
